channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-11176] KMSClientProvider authentication fails when both currentUgi and loginUgi are a proxied user
item.description:
In a secure environment, with kerberos, when the KMSClientProvider instance is created in the context of a proxied user, The initial SPNEGO handshake is made with the currentUser (the proxied user) as the Principal.. this will fail, since the proxied user is not logged in.
The handshake must be done using the real user.
item.summary: KMSClientProvider authentication fails when both currentUgi and loginUgi are a proxied user

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Uploading initial patch with testcase to reproduce the issue..

Please do note.. as demonstrated in the testcases, it can fail in the case of SIMPLE auth as well since both the "user.name" and "doAs" parameters sent by KMSClientProvider to the KMS server would always be the same... this patch fixes that..

+1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12673615/HADOOP-11176.1.patch
against trunk revision 1efd9c9.

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 1 new or modified test files.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. There were no new javadoc warning messages.

+1 eclipse:eclipse. The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common hadoop-common-project/hadoop-kms.

+1 contrib tests. The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/4877//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/4877//console

This message is automatically generated.

asuresh,

Just two nits.

This change:

      final String doAsUser = (currentUgi.getAuthenticationMethod() ==
          UserGroupInformation.AuthenticationMethod.PROXY) 
                              ? currentUgi.getShortUserName() : null;

seems to be a whitespace only change.

This change:

          return authUrl.openConnection(
              url,
              authToken, doAsUser);

seems to be an extraneous reformatting.
Reverting whitespace and formatting changes.. thanks for the review clamb

+1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12673645/HADOOP-11176.2.patch
against trunk revision e16e25a.

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 1 new or modified test files.

+1 javadoc. There were no new javadoc warning messages.

+1 eclipse:eclipse. The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common hadoop-common-project/hadoop-kms.

+1 contrib tests. The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/4880//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/4880//console

This message is automatically generated.

The patch looks pretty good to me, and it's a good catch. I have one nit and a few small comments:

Comments:

  1. The variable name "loginUgi" is now a bit misleading, since it's not necessarily actually attempting to refer to the login UGI of the process where this KMSClientProvider is running. Suggest renaming it to something like "serverUgi" or something more clear.
  2. I'm not crazy about re-assigning the loginUgi instance variable in the createConnection method. What if at some point later in the life of this KMSClientProvider some authentication method other than PROXY is used? I suggest making that instance var final, maybe renaming it to "ugiAtCreate" or something, and then setting a local var appropriately in createConnection to the correct UGI and using that.

Nit:

  1. There's two semicolons at the end of this line: 
    +        loginUgi = UserGroupInformation.getCurrentUser().getRealUser();;

+1 once these are addressed.

Thanks a lot, Arun.

Uploading updated patch

Thanks for the review atm,

  • changed name of loginUgi to actualUgi (felt it might be better than serverUgi)
  • actualUgi is now a final field initialized to either currentUgi or realUgi if currentUgi is a Proxy. This way, we wont need to create a new variable at the time of createConnection()

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12674091/HADOOP-11176.3.patch
against trunk revision cbd21fd.

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 1 new or modified test files.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. There were no new javadoc warning messages.

+1 eclipse:eclipse. The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 2 new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

-1 release audit. The applied patch generated 1 release audit warnings.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common hadoop-common-project/hadoop-kms.

+1 contrib tests. The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/4896//testReport/
Release audit warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/4896//artifact/patchprocess/patchReleaseAuditProblems.txt
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/4896//artifact/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshadoop-common.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/4896//console

This message is automatically generated.

• The findBugs warnings are actually unrelated to the patch.. they will start to show up since HADOOP-11178 (which fixes the findBugs exclusion file) is resolved. They should go away once HADOOP-11122 is fixed and committed
  • The release audit warning also looks unrelated

+1, the latest patch looks good to me. The change seems much clearer to me now, and I agree that the RAT and findbugs warnings are unrelated.

I'm going to commit this momentarily.

I've just committed this to trunk, branch-2, and branch-2.6.

Thanks a lot for the contribution, Arun, and thanks also to Charlie for the review.
